properties.name: sap.apf.constants

Constants to be used by APF consumers.

nodes.name: sap.apf.Api
nodes.description:
Official API for Analysis Path Framework (APF)

The APF API provides a consuming application access to the functionality of the APF.

parameters.name: XsrfToken
parameters.description: XSRF token which can be reused for back-end connectivity. If no XSRF token is passed, a new one will be fetched from back end.

constructor.description: Provides the connectivity to the LRep & UI5 Flexibility Services REST-routes

returnValue.description: Returns a String with all parameters concatenated

parameters.name: aParams
parameters.description: Array of parameter objects in format {name:, value:}

parameters.name: sNamespace

methods.description: Delete a file via REST call.

parameters.description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change. Default LREP namespace is "localchange".

methods.description: Retrieves the file attributes for a given resource in the LREP.

methods.name: getStaticResource

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change. Default LREP namespace is "localchange".

parameters.name: bIsRuntime
parameters.description: The stored file content is handed over to the lrep provider that can dynamically adjust the content to the runtime context (e.g. do text replacement to the users' logon language) before

methods.description: Authenticated access to a resource in the Lrep

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The file namespace goes here. It is needed to identify the change.

methods.description: Retrieves the content for a given namespace and layer via REST call.

returnValue.description: Returns a promise to the result of the request

parameters.name: sMethod
parameters.description: HTTP-method to be used by this request (default GET)

parameters.name: mOptions
parameters.description: Additional options which should be used in the request

methods.description: Send a request to the back end

symbols.name: sap.apf.Api
symbols.description:
Official API for Analysis Path Framework (APF)

The APF API provides a consuming application access to the functionality of the APF. It is assumed that the consuming application extends type sap.apf.base.Component. The API reference is returned by method sap.apf.base.Component#getApi.
Objects and types returned by methods of APF API or passed in parameters of APF API method also belong to the API. These objects and types are documented in their respective sections of this documentation. All methods, objects or types that are not explicitly documented as public are strictly internal and may be changed without prior notice. This also includes all methods, objects or types being classified as experimental.
Furthermore there is no need to instantiate required entities directly by applying the JavaScript 'new'-operator on their respective constructors. Instead they should be created by consumers using a create method available on API-level, such as e.g. sap.apf.Api#createMessageObject for sap.apf.core.MessageObject or sap.apf.Api#createFilter for sap.apf.utils.Filter.

parameters.name: oComponent
parameters.description: A reference to the calling Component.js. The reference provides access to parameters and context.

parameters.name: inject
parameters.description: injected constructors and functions for testing only.

parameters.name: manifests
parameters.description: manifests of the component and the base component itself

methods.name: activateOnErrorHandling

parameters.name: bHandling
parameters.description: Boolean true switches the winow.onerror handling on

methods.description: The handling of the window.onerror by the message handler is either switched on or off. Per default the handling is deactivated.

methods.name: addMasterFooterContent
methods.description: Adds an element to the footer area.

deprecated.text: Remains in api in order to maintain downward compatibility to 3 Wave 5 apps.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.23.1. Remains in api in order to maintain downward compatibility to 3 Wave 5 apps.

methods.name: addPathFilter

returnValue.description: ID to be provided for later updates of the same filter via method updatePathFilter.

methods.description: Adds a filter to the path. Subsequent changes need to be done by the update method providing the identifier. Restriction: Only a single filter term or a disjunction/conjunction of single terms over a single property is supported. Restriction: Only the operators EQ, LE (less equal than) and GE (greater equal than) are supported.

methods.name: createFilter
methods.description: Creates an empty filter object. Its methods can be used to create a logical filter expression.

methods.name: createMessageObject

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The message is classified by its code. The code identifies an entry in the message configuration.

parameters.name: aParameters
parameters.description: Additional parameters for the message. The parameters are filled into the message text, when the message will be processed by the text resource handler.

parameters.name: oCallingObject
parameters.description: Reference of the calling object. This can be used later to visualize on the user interface, where the message occurred.

methods.description: Creates a message object, which is the mandatory parameter for API method putMessage. So first create the message object and afterwards call putMessage with the message object as argument.

methods.name: createReadRequest

parameters.name: requestConfiguration
parameters.description: identifies a request configuration, which is contained in the analytical configuration. or the request configuration is directly passed as an object oRequestConfiguration.

methods.description:
Creates an object for performing an Odata Request get operation.

References:

  • sap.apf#createReadRequest

methods.name: customFormat

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: custom format function need to be called.

methods.description: helps to call customer defined custom formatter function(fnCallback).

methods.name: getPathFilter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the path filter fragment as it was returned by addPathFilter method.

methods.description: Gets a path filter fragment for the given identifier by fully replacing the existing one.

methods.name: getTextHtmlEncoded

parameters.name: aParameters
parameters.description: Array with parameters to replace place holders in text.

methods.description: Retrieves a text and applies HTML encoding

methods.name: getTextNotHtmlEncoded

parameters.name: aParameters
parameters.description: Array with parameters to replace place holders in text.

methods.description: Retrieves a text without application of HTML encoding

methods.name: loadApplicationConfig

parameters.name: sFilePath
parameters.description: The absolute path of an application configuration file. Host and port will be added in front of this path.

methods.description: Loads a new application configuration in JSON format. When called many times, the file is loaded only the first time.

methods.name: putMessage

parameters.name: oMessage
parameters.description: The message object shall be created by method sap.apf.Api#createMessageObject.

methods.description: A message is passed to the APF message handler for further processing. All message specific settings (e.g. message code or severity) need to be passed within an APF message object instance.

methods.name: selectionChanged
methods.description: Calls the sap.apf.core.instance#updatePath (also see sap.apf.core.Path#update) with proper callback for UI. It also refreshes the steps either from the active step or all the steps depending on the boolean value passed.

methods.name: setCallbackAfterApfStartup

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: that will be executed after APF start-up and content has been created.

methods.description: Register the function callback to be executed after APF start-up and content has been created. Callback is called with APF API instance as parameter and 'this' set to the Component instance.

methods.name: setCallbackBeforeApfStartup

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: that will be executed before APF start-up.

methods.description: Register the function callback to be executed before APF start-up. Callback is called with APF API instance as parameter and 'this' set to the Component instance.

methods.name: setEventCallback

returnValue.description: true or false based on success or failure of registering the listener.

parameters.name: sEventType
parameters.description: is the type of event for registering the fnCallback for that particular event type printTriggered - Registers a callback for initial page print, this callback returns 2d array contextChanged : Registers a callback for context change, which will set the context of the application

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: that will be executed depending on the event type.

methods.description: Register the function callback to be executed on the given event type. fnCallback will be executed under a context and will be passed with arguments depending on the event type.

methods.name: startupSucceeded
methods.description: true, when no fatal error occurred during startup phase. Startup phase includes the initialization + startupApf

methods.name: updatePathFilter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the path filter as it was returned by addPathFilter method. When using an ID of type string the caller must ensure that it is unique.

methods.description: Updates a filter of the path. Restriction: Only a single filter term or a disjunction/conjunction of single terms over a single property is supported. Restriction: Only the operators EQ, LE (less equal than) and GE (greater equal than) are supported.

symbols.name: sap.apf.core.MessageObject
symbols.description: The message object represents the APF specific message object for detailed evaluation. The message object shall be created by method sap.apf.Api#createMessageObject.

methods.name: getCallingObject
methods.description: Returns the calling object

methods.name: getCode
methods.description: Returns the message code.

methods.name: getJQueryVersion
methods.description: Returns the version of jQuery

methods.name: getMessage
methods.description: Returns the message text.

methods.name: getParameters
methods.description: Returns the parameter which were passed over

methods.name: getPrevious
methods.description: Gets the previous message object.

methods.name: getRawText
methods.description: Returns raw text.

methods.name: getSapUi5Version
methods.description: Returns the version of SAP UI5

methods.name: getSeverity
methods.description: Returns the severity.

methods.name: getStack
methods.description: Returns the stack of the error object to get the line number and source file

methods.description: Returns the time stamp of the message object in seconds after 1970

methods.name: getTimestampAsdateObject
methods.description: Returns the time stamp of the message object as a date

methods.name: hasRawText
methods.description: Returns true, if a raw text is set.

methods.name: setCode
methods.description: Sets the code, that classifies the message.

methods.name: setMessage
methods.description: Sets the message text.

methods.name: setPrevious
methods.description: Sets the previous message object. One can add a message object to this message object, that describes a previous message. The message in the previous message object will also be displayed in the log (as previous entry).

methods.name: setSeverity

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Only for to build in error messages. Allowed values are defined in sap.apf.constants.severity.

methods.description: Sets the severity , which classifies the message.

symbols.name: sap.apf.core.ReadRequest
symbols.description: Facade for sap.apf.core.Request for getting data via the OData protocol. This corresponds to a normal HTTP GET method. Creation is done via APF API.

parameters.name: oRequest
parameters.description: The object represents an OData GET request.

parameters.name: sService
parameters.description: Service defined by the analytical content configuration.

parameters.name: sEntityType
parameters.description: Entity type defined by the analytical content configuration.

methods.name: getMetadataFacade
methods.description: Returns {sap.apf.core.MetadataFacade} which provides convenience methods for accessing metadata (only for the service document, which is assigned to this read request instance).

methods.name: send

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: The first argument of the callback function is the received data (as Array). The second argument is {sap.apf.core.EntityTypeMetadata}. The third argument is {sap.apf.core.MessageObject}.

parameters.name: oRequestOptions
parameters.description: An optional object containing additional query string options Format: { orderby : [{ property : , order : }], top : , skip : }

methods.description: Executes an OData request.

symbols.name: sap.apf.core.ReadRequestByRequiredFilter
symbols.description: Facade for sap.apf.core.Request for getting data via the OData protocol. This corresponds to a normal HTTP GET method. Creation is done via APF API. In addition to the handed over filter argument in method send(), the required filters and parameter entity set key properties of the configured entity type are applied, which are determined from path filter.

parameters.name: oRequest
parameters.description: The object represents an OData GET request.

parameters.name: sService
parameters.description: Service defined by the analytical content configuration.

parameters.name: sEntityType
parameters.description: Entity type defined by the analytical content configuration.

methods.name: getMetadataFacade
methods.description: Returns {sap.apf.core.MetadataFacade} which provides convenience methods for accessing metadata (only for the service document, which is assigned to this read request instance).

methods.name: send

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: The first argument of the callback function is the received data (as Array). The second argument is {sap.apf.core.EntityTypeMetadata}. The third argument is {sap.apf.core.MessageObject}.

parameters.name: oRequestOptions
parameters.description: An optional object containing additional query string options Format: { orderby : [{ property : , order : }], top : , skip : }

methods.description: Executes an OData request.

methods.description:
It is called during start of APF.

Gets the configured visible facet filters and draws the facet filter. In case the first step is configured for the application it is created. In addition the callback for updating the path is also registered.

symbols.name: sap.apf.ui.representations.representationInterface
symbols.description: This is not a runtime class, but it describes the interface that a representation (chart) has to implement for to interact with the APF.

experimental.text: The complete interface is subject to ongoing work and not yet stable (as of Version 1.24.0).

parameters.name: dependencies
parameters.description: specific interface proxy for communication between the representation and APF.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description:
Configuration object that allows to define representation specific configuration values.
Fixed interface property names:

  • alternateRepresentationTypeId: A reference to a representation type in analytical configuration
  • alternateRepresentationType: A property dynamically added to the parameter object by APF core based on reference in alternateRepresentationTypeId and containing configuration values of the representation type ID referenced by alternateRepresentationTypeId.

methods.name: adoptSelection
methods.description: Called on representation by binding when a representation type is set. Intention is to trigger transfer of selections that might exist on a representation (source) that is replaced by the "new" representation (target) to be set. Therefore the target representation receives a reference pointing to the source representation. In order to check whether selection transfer is possible the target representation initiates a negotiation process with the source representations (3-way-handshake). If a common method can be determined between target and source representation the selection will be exchanged.

methods.name: deserialize
methods.description: This method uses the serialization information from serialized data and sets the selection to representation based on mode and selection string returned.

methods.name: getAlternateRepresentation
methods.description: Returns the alternate representation of current step (i.e. list representation for the charts)

methods.name: getData
methods.description: Returns data for representation type

methods.name: getFilterMethodType

returnValue.description: The filter method type the representation supports

methods.description: This method has to be implemented so that binding can determine which method has to be used for the filter retrieval from a representations.

methods.name: getMainContent

returnValue.description: oUiObject The UI object that has to be shown in main representation area. Example: Line chart instance for a line chart representation.

methods.description: This method holds the logic to draw the content to be shown on main representation area.

methods.name: getMetaData
methods.description: Returns meta data for representation type

methods.name: getParameter
methods.description: The method returns the constructor arguments which will be used to create toggle representation.

methods.name: getPrintContent

returnValue.description: oUiObject The UI object that has to be printed. Example: Line chart instance for a line chart representation.

methods.description: This method holds the logic to draw the content to be printed.

methods.name: getRequestOptions

returnValue.description:
Example: 

{ paging : {
		top : 10,
		skip : 30,
		inlineCount : true
 },
 orderby : [ 
		{ property : "nameProperty1",
		}, {
		property : "nameProperty2",
		ascending : true
		}
 ]
}
See also http://www.odata.org/documentation/odata-version-2-0/uri-conventions/

methods.description:
Additionally to parameters being set in the request configuration and filter values that are derived from the path logic, a request can be enriched with additional options such as $top, $skip and $orderby.

Dependent on the actual options a representation may require for a request, an object containing the correspondent properties may be returned by this method.
In case no additional options are required an empty object should be returned.

The supported optional properties of the return object are:

  • paging: An object containing optional properties
    • top for OData system query option $top
      A numeric value is expected
    • skip for query string option $skip
      A numeric value is expected
    • inlineCount for OData system query option $inlineCount
      A boolean value 'true' is expected if inline count is requested
  • orderby for OData system query option $orderby: Values could be of type
    • string that holds a property name (in this case the default sort order 'ascending' is applied)
    • object with properties:
      • 'property' A string containing the property name is expected.
      • 'ascending' A boolean value 'true' is expected, if ascending sort order is required for the property. If omitted default sort order 'descending' is applied.
    • array holding objects with properties 'property' and 'ascending' as described above.

methods.name: getSelectionAsArray

returnValue.description:
An array with indices is returned.
E.g. if the first and the third line of the array aDataResponse have been selected, then aIndices = [0, 2]. Counting of indices start from 0. If all data has been selected, and aDataResponse.length == 4, then the array [0,1,2,3] is returned. In general [ 0 .. aDataResponse.length - 1] If no data has been selected at all, then [] is returned. In case of an empty selection, the value undefined has to be returned. An empty selection may occur, when selections in the previous step has been changed, so that the visual selection on the chart is now empty (empty rectangle).

methods.description: This is the basic method with which the step can detect data selected in the chart.

methods.name: getThumbnailContent

returnValue.description: oUiObject The UI object that has to be shown in thumbnail area. Example: Line chart instance for a line chart representation.

methods.description: This method holds the logic to draw the content to be shown on thumbnail area.

methods.name: getTooltipContent

returnValue.description: oUiObject The UI object that has to be shown as tooltip for a thumbnail. Example: Detailed content of a form representation.

methods.description: This method holds the logic to draw the content to be shown as tooltip for a thumbnail. It will be shown inside a tooltip Popup when the thumbnail content overflows the thumbnail container area with a gradient effect to indicate that it is overflowing.

methods.name: removeAllSelection
methods.description: This method holds the logic to remove all selection from the chart. It also updates the step.

methods.name: serialize
methods.description: This method returns the selection for serialization. This is required for the Persisting selection of current representation. It includes selection mode and selections.

methods.name: setData

parameters.name: oMetadata
parameters.description: oMetadata holds meta information about the received data.

methods.description: The binding sets the data (received from the request) that has to be visualized. The array aDataResponse is shared between all representations of a step and the binding. When lines are moved, deleted or changed, you modify the visualization of the original data! When displaying the data, one can determine which record is selected by aSelectedIndices.

methods.name: updateTreetable

parameters.name: controlObject
parameters.description: Contains filters and parameters for treetable request handling

parameters.name: oModel
parameters.description: OData model for the service of treetable

parameters.name: callbackAfterRequest
parameters.description: Function to be called after request processing

methods.description: Called during path update for treetable representation. As treetable has its own data model, the request handling is done on representation side.

experimental.text: The complete interface is subject to ongoing work and not yet stable (as of Version 1.24.0).

methods.description: see sap.apf.Api#createFilter

methods.name: createMessageObject

symbols.title: class sap.apf.ui.representations.RepresentationInterfaceProxy

constructor.description: It is designed to be used for supplying context information for the application. In addition, it can be used for exchanging filter values between the path and the facet filters. This function object supports the top down construction of filter expressions.

methods.name: createFilterFromSapUi5FilterJSON
methods.description: Creates a filter from json format, that comes from selection variant. Apf creates this filter format with method Filter#mapToSapUI5FilterExpression. See there for description of the format.

methods.name: getById

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the object to be returned.

methods.description: Returns filter object or expression for a given ID, if exists.

methods.name: getExpressions

returnValue.description: Array of AND terms, OR terms and expressions.

methods.description: Returns the logical operations and the boolean expressions of a Filter object as nested arrays for the logical operations and single level objects for the boolean expressions. Depending on the nesting level of the arrays the logical operators for the terms in the arrays alternates between AND and OR. The array on the highest level has the logical operator AND. It corresponds to the TopAnd filter term. Terms in general can be composed of the logical operation AND (see the FilterAnd object) or OR (see the FilterOr object) or be a boolean expression (see the FilterExpression object). AND and OR terms are returned as arrays; boolean expressions are returned as objects.

methods.name: getOperators
methods.description: Convenience function to get the OData operators which are defined in {constants.FilterOperators}.

methods.name: getTopAnd
methods.description: Returns the top 'AND' object of the filter.

methods.name: intersectWith

returnValue.description: new CoreFilter object sap.apf.utils.Filter for the intersected filters

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Single filter object sap.apf.utils.Filter, a comma separated parameter list of filter objects, or an array of filter objects

methods.description: Build the intersection of the this filter object with the supplied filter(s). The method does not change the "this"-instance.

methods.name: updateExpression
methods.description: Updates an expression.

methods.name: updateValue

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the expression object to be updated

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new low value for the expression (optional)

parameters.name: high
parameters.description: The new high value for the expression (optional)

methods.description: Updates a value of an expression object.

methods.name: addExpression
methods.description: Adds an expression object to this filter.

methods.name: addOr

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Identifier for the object to be added.

methods.description: Adds an object of type {sap.apf.utils.FilterOr}.

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Returns ID of this filter object.

methods.name: addAnd

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Identifier for the object to be added.

methods.description: Adds an object of type sap.apf.utils.FilterAnd.

methods.name: addExpression
methods.description: Adds an expression object to this filter.

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Retrieves an ID of the term.
